articles.title: NASA Webb telescope launch delayed after incident - CTV News
articles.description: The European Space Agency says the launch of a new NASA telescope to replace the famed Hubble observatory is being postponed to allow experts to check the device for possible damage following an incident at its spaceport in French Guiana.
articles.content:

articles.title: Why the UK seems less likely to go into lockdown than European counterparts - Evening Standard

articles.title: 'Jabbed, cured or dead', Germany warns as Europe battles COVID surge - Eyewitness News
articles.description: Europe's return to the pandemic's epicentre has been blamed on a sluggish vaccine uptake in some nations, the highly contagious Delta variant and colder weather moving people indoors again.

articles.title: Photos: Europeans protest Covid-19 restrictions - CNN
articles.description: Protesters in several European countries gathered over the weekend to push back against new Covid-19 restrictions. Some of the demonstrations turned violent.
articles.content: Workers clear debris from a damaged car in Rotterdam, Netherlands, on Saturday, November 20. There were violent clashes the night before as people protested against the country's new Covid-19 restric… [+1065 chars]

articles.title: Austria locks down, Merkel says new steps needed as Europe faces COVID freeze - Reuters
articles.description: Austria became on Monday the first country in western Europe to reimpose lockdown since vaccines were rolled out, shutting non-essential shops, bars and cafes as surging caseloads raised the spectre of a second straight winter in deep freeze for the continent.

articles.title: Dollar shines, euro suffers as COVID-19 fears flare over Europe - CNA
articles.description:
TOKYO: The safe-haven US dollar traded close to a 16-month high to the euro on Monday (Nov 22) on growing anxiety over the impact of surging COVID-19 infections in Europe, with Austria reimposing a full lockdown and Germany considering following suit.
